result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith D Binder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Attempt Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Each ct concur.
9/30/16 Probation is extended for 6 mo from 11/5/16 to 5/5/17, or until all court obligations are completed, whichever comes first.

miscConds.notes: DA has 90 days to prepare/submit order.  To be collected by the Department of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervison or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
$253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with JJ without written permission of agent or Speedway Convenience Stores in Dane County, WI.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

and Notice of DNA and Witness List (Plaintiff's)
Status conference on June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2000 per case, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
  - Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Joshua J.
  - Defendant shall not be at the Speedway gas station on Royal Ave. in Monona. 
  - Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless accompanied by a parent or legal guardian, unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
   - Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
  Defendant waived the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge -  Br 5

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Joshua M Bowland appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
